abstract: JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive assailed some banking regulation, decried the notion that some banks are too big to fail and asserted that his bank did not need a $25 billion bailout.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive assailed some banking regulation, decried the notion that some banks are too big to fail and asserted that his bank did not need a $25 billion bailout.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, despises some of the new federal regulations that his bank faces — and he is not reluctant to tell you so.

headline.main: Dimon Brings On the Drama at the Chamber
